hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition on Failed High-Volume Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regime, when BTC attempts >5% breakout on 2x average volume but fails to close above key level (previous high -2%), it signals distribution and leads to BEAR transition within 3-7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-volume rejection indicates strong selling at resistance. Reduced follow-through volume shows lack of conviction. Failed breakouts in neutral regimes often precede bearish transitions.
entry_conditions: Closes below breakout level (within 2% of attempt)
Next day shows narrow range (<2%) on reduced volume (-30% vs breakout day)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to BEAR (confidence >70%) OR 12% gain on short
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims breakout level with volume confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Failed breakout is immediately reclaimed with volume within 48 hours (false rejection).
